Reviews.Title: “Cute and different”
Reviews.Author: Gordon3638
Reviews.Content: Situated in the heart of Berlin this hotel is located opposite a Bunker that once was occupied by Hitler. Our room was small together with a small bathroom but provided all that was necessary for us. unusual in that neither the room or the hallways had any carpet on lino. The breakfast included in the tarrif was adequate but not extensive unless you are used to German sausage and hard boiled eggs. We can't complain about the reception or desk service but conversation was minimal. Overall we were happy with this budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room, just OK, internet non-existent, location great”
Reviews.Author: sneilkSpain
Reviews.Content: We needed a place in the MItte. The location was perfect. The room was spacious but sparce. The bathroom was super tiny. All was very clean. The real problem was the internet. They said they had a connection in the room and actually had the nerve to charge 5 euro daily when there was really no connection at all unless you went out onto the street and into the next building where the reception was. I had signed on for four days of internet service. After the first day I complained and told him I didn't want to pay for the lousy service and to cancel it. He said that was fine and told me where I might find an internet cafe close by. When I checked out however, it was back on my bill for all nights. He said because he had seen me trying to connect in the coffee room once, I was using the service. It was a fight I lost but will take it up with my credit card company. Staff in general were either cold or just not around so not helpful in any way. The best thing about the hotel was the WWII bunker across the street, now a gallery.. now that's a great place to viist...

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice experience: good quality & decent price”
Reviews.Author: MLK93
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel despite the mixed reviews for a short trip to Berlin. This wasn't my first time in the city and I actually walked past this hotel several times on my last visit to Berlin, so I already knew that it was well-located. What I didn't know was that the hotel rooms actually occupy only the ground floor of the building with the reception and the breakfast room located just underneath. Our room smelled freshly cleaned and we had a nice view of the street through a big window. Breakfast was plenty and far better than most of the other hotels I stayed with in Berlin. Wi-Fi did work in our room, but speeds were faster if you stayed next to the reception while surfing. We also liked the free 5 o'clock tea and cookies (actually from 5 pm to 8 pm). So, if you don't expect any thrills, but a central hotel in a typical Berlin-atmosphere with all the amenities you need for an affordable price, this would be the place to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced-feeling ripped off”
Reviews.Author: Baron095
Reviews.Content: The saving grace for this hotel is its handy location. Apart from that it was overpriced for what you get. . Having stayed there 4 years ago it was great and hence did not check the reviews for this recent booking. It has obviously changed management. Reception staff could not speak any english or had absolutely no comprehension. Internet did not work in the rooms despite them advertising it did. To use the internet one had to find one's way through the maze of corridors and doors before getting to the reception area where it worked. Rooms are large but very cold. Wooden chipboard floors were cold to the feet. Our first two nights we could not sleep due to our room being on the corner of two main streets and only after complaining were we moved to what was obviously a more superior room despite us already paying top dollar.Breakfast was limited and on occasion we did not bother going down.Could not get out of our 5 day booking due to cancellation charges so we grinned and bore it!

Reviews.Title: “Four star locatiom, three star price, two star value”
Reviews.Author: mklein818
Reviews.Content: This joint is clearly an old school two star, with small beds, a weak breakfast, and very limited amenities for at or above Eur 100 a night. The location is a saving grace, a short walk from Friedrichstrasse and Unter den Linden. If location is an issue, stay: if location is not an issue, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “100 Euro for Hostel.Good location but basic and expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Malanese
Reviews.Content: It's looking like a Hostel with privat rooms.Reception is very small and it's hard to find main entry.Almost all hotel has russian staff (or from countries of former USSR).They speaks in german,english,russian but...it's hard to say that they are frendly. Rooms are huge and clean but need renovation.Bathroom ,windows and doors are old and working not so good. Hotel is on small ,and peaceful street ,but very close from main museums and atraction of east Berlin.Location is really great! In my opinion price 100 Euro in this standart and poor brakfast is so much. Better to find normal hotel on this area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Hotel Amelie”
Reviews.Author: JBHSomerset
Reviews.Content: I selected Hotel Amelie because of its position in Berlin - within easy reach of some main sites and the Hauptbahnhof - and the price seemed reasonable approx 90 Euoros for a single room with bathroom per night. They failed to tell me that my accommodation was not in the building where reception was but in a separate building where there was no direct daylight in the corridors and frankly I didn't feel particularly safe. The staff were unfriendly and the breakfast staff particularly unwelcoming -breakfast was served back in the building where reception was. No one spoke, in fact the girl on reception hardly lifted her head to acknowledge me. Far from being a guest, I felt a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel as far as you can”
Reviews.Author: basilbasil
Reviews.Content: When I booked a room in this hotel it said that there was a wireless Internet and using the Internet was included. In fact, it is not. It costs 5 euros a day, and you cannot use it in your room. You can use the internet in the lobby, and (sic!) an access to the lobby is "granted" until 10pm. In addition, when using a credit card I had to pay 5% more of the price booked. Finally, the room was so small that, standing at any spot in the room, you could not jump in any direction.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Harry040709
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a very handy location for seeing the sights of Berlin for a reasonable cost No frills particularly but good value I thought

Reviews.Title: “Surprised on the upside!”
Reviews.Author: paulene_tavani
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been recently renovated (rooms still smelled of new paint). Room & bathroom was clean and nice. Breakfast was good too. Very close to cafe strips and city centre. Staff were helpful!
